javax.json

Class JsonPointer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.json.JsonPointer

  • public class JsonPointer
extends Object

    This class is an immutable representation of a JSON Pointer as specified in RFC 6901.

    A JsonPointer is only meanful when it is applied to a target, which can be any JsonValue.

    A JsonPointer with an empty JSON Pointer string defines a reference to the target.

    A JsonPointer with a non-empty JSON Pointer string, which must be a sequence of '/' prefixed tokens, defines a reference to a value in a JsonArray or JsonArray. In this case, the target must be a JsonObject or JsonArray.

    The method getValue() returns the referenced value. The methods add(), replace(), and remove() executes the operations specified in RFC 6902.

    Since:
    1.1

      • getValue

      • add

        public JsonValue add(JsonValue target,
                     JsonValue value)
        Add or replace a value at the referenced location in the specified JsonValue.
        1. If the reference is the target, the value, which must be the same type as target, is returned.
        2. If the reference is an index to an array, the value is inserted into the array at the index. If the index is specified with a "-", or if the index is equal to the size of the array, the value is appended to the array.
        3. If the reference is a name of a JsonObject, and the referenced value exists, the value is replaced by the specified value. If it does not exists, a new name/value pair is added to the object.
        Parameters:
        target - the target JsonValue
        value - the value to be added
        Returns:
        the resultant JsonValue
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index to the array is out of range

      • replace

        public JsonStructure replace(JsonStructure target,
                             JsonValue value)
        Replace the value at the referenced location in the specified JsonStructure with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        target - the target JsonStructure
        value - the value to be stored at the referenced location
        Returns:
        the resultant JsonStructure
        Throws:
        JsonException - if the referenced location does not exists, or if the reference is the target.

      • remove

        public JsonStructure remove(JsonStructure target)
        Remove the value at the reference location in the specified JsonStructure
        Parameters:
        target - the target JsonStructure
        Returns:
        the resultant JsonStructure
        Throws:
        JsonException - if the referenced location does not exists, or if the reference is the target.

      • add

        public JsonObject add(JsonObject target,
                      JsonValue value)
        Add or replace a value at the referenced location in the specified JsonObject. If the reference is the target JsonObject, the value, which must be a JsonObject, is returned. If the referenced value exists in the target object, it is replaced by the specified value. If it does not exists, a new name/value pair is added to the object.
        Parameters:
        target - the target JsonObject
        value - the value to be added
        Returns:
        the resultant JsonObject

      • add

        public JsonArray add(JsonArray target,
                     JsonValue value)
        Insert a value at the referenced location in the specified JsonArray. If the reference is the target JsonArray, the value, which must be a JsonArray, is returned. If the reference is an index of an array, the value is inserted into the array at the index. If the index is specified with a "-", or if the index is equal to the size of the array, the value is appended to the array.
        Parameters:
        target - the target JsonArray
        value - the value to be added
        Returns:
        the resultant JsonArray
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index to the array is out of range

      • replace

        public JsonObject replace(JsonObject target,
                          JsonValue value)
        Replace the value at the referenced location in the specified JsonObject with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        target - the target JsonObject
        value - the value be stored at the referenced location
        Returns:
        the resultant JsonObject
        Throws:
        JsonException - if the regerenced location does not exists, or if the reference is the target.
